pr_title: Fixed Uphold configuration of prod builds for Travis CD

timeline.message:
Used the Travis Files Automated Encryption to securely replace Uphold API test keys with
the production ones when deploying prod builds
Removed skip_cleanup parameter (deprecated in dpl v2 and replaced with cleanup param being false by default)

timeline.bodyText: Will a testnet build use this encrypted file also?
timeline.author: HashEngineering
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -77,6 +77,7 @@ script:
 - ./gradlew test
 - ./gradlew assemble_testNet3Debug
 - rm -rf .gradle/4.4
+- openssl aes-256-cbc -K $encrypted_1615d4cf65a2_key -iv $encrypted_1615d4cf65a2_iv -in .deploy/UpholdConstants.enc -out uphold-integration/src/main/java/org/dash/wallet/integration/uphold/data/UpholdConstants.java -d

replies.bodyText:
No, test builds use the original one.
The build script is executed line by line, so it will first do
- ./gradlew assemble_testNet3Debug
- rm -rf .gradle/4.4

then decrypt UpholdConstants.enc and replace UpholdConstants.java.
Finally it will build prod APKs using modified sources
- ./gradlew assembleProdDebug
- ./gradlew assembleProdRelease
replies.author: tomasz-ludek
